description: A collection of circles in a small circular formation atop a roughly pentagonal formation that stretches downwards and tapers, connecting to another roughly pentagonal formation of circles; below that is a flat ovular formation of circles. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a blue triangle in the center of the large pentagonal formation and a light greenish-blue triangle on the left side of the ovular formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
